db:abstract.db:para: A widget-based application that sends data to and receives it from a compiled ECMAScript data model.

db:article.db:para: Media Player Example (Static) demonstrates how to access data from an ECMAScript data model that is compiled into a C++ class.
The UI is created using Qt Widgets.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Using the ECMAScript Data Model
db:section.db:para: We specify the data model as a value of the datamodel attribute of the <scxml> element in mediaplayer-common/mediaplayer.scxml:
db:section.db:programlisting: <scxml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/07/scxml" version="1.0" name="MediaPlayerStateMachine" initial="stopped" datamodel="ecmascript" > <datamodel> <data id="media"/> </datamodel>

db:section.db:title: Connecting to States
db:section.db:para: The media player state machine will send out events when users tap a control and when playback starts or stops, as specified in the SCXML file:
db:section.db:programlisting:
<state id="stopped"> <transition event="tap" cond="isValidMedia()" target="playing"/> </state>
<state id="playing"> <onentry> <assign location="media" expr="_event.data.media"/> <send event="playbackStarted"> <param name="media" expr="media"/> </send> </onentry>
<onexit> <send event="playbackStopped"> <param name="media" expr="media"/> </send> </onexit>
<transition event="tap" cond="!isValidMedia() || media === _event.data.media" target="stopped"/> <transition event="tap" cond="isValidMedia() && media !== _event.data.media" target="playing"/> </state>
